source.defaults module¶

source.dispatcher module¶

This module is used to ‘dispatch’ or execute a particular schedule file. When the schedule file completes, the dispatcher is finished. This module can be run from command line with an optional argument specifying the path to a schedule file. Alternatively, this module can be run as a multiprocessing.Process and given a multiprocessing.Pipe for communication to other processes.

source.dispatcher.devicesInRange(startContact, endContact, skip=True)[source]¶

Deprecated function for generating a list of devices.

source.dispatcher.dispatch(schedule_file_path=None, pipe=None)[source]¶

Given a schedule file path, begin executing the experiments in the schedule file, otherwise prompt the user for a schedule file.

source.dispatcher.run_file(schedule_file_path, pipe=None)[source]¶

Given a shedule file path, open the file and step through each experiment.

source.dispatcher.send_notification_via_pushbullet(title, body)[source]¶

source.launcher module¶

This module is used to ‘launch’ or execute a particular experiment. When the experiment completes, the launcher is finished. Experiments are typically fed to the launcher by a dispatcher as it reads experiments out of a schedule file. The launcher can also be run by providing a subset of the parameters found in defaults.py, but it is still recommended to define these parameters in a schedule file and have a dispatcher handle execution.

source.launcher.initArduino(parameters)[source]¶

Given the parameters for running an experiment, sets up a connection to the (usually optional) Arduino.

source.launcher.initMeasurementSystems(parameters)[source]¶

Given the parameters for running an experiment, sets up a connection to the necessary SMU or SMUs.

source.launcher.run(additional_parameters, communication_pipe=None)[source]¶

Begins execution of an experiment whose parameters are defined by the union of addition_parameters and defaults.py. Also initializes a connection to the necessary SMU systems and/or Arduino systems needed to perform the experiment.

source.launcher.runAction(parameters, schedule_parameters, smu_systems, arduino_instance, communication_pipe=None)[source]¶

Prepares the file system for the upcoming experiment and selects a Procedure to carry out the experiment. In the event of an error during any procedure, this function is responsible for emergency ramping down the SMU voltages and exiting as gracefully as possible.

source.manager module¶

This module manages the connection between the UI and dispatchers. On startup, this starts the UI and can also immediately give a dispatcher a schedule file to run, or the UI can be used to navigate schedule files and choose one to run. At any given time, this module can manage 1 UI process and 1 dispatcher process.

source.manager.changePriorityOfProcessAndChildren(pid, priority)[source]¶

Must be called after starting a process. Change the priority of the process with a given PID and all of its child processes.

source.manager.getPriorityCode(priority)[source]¶

Priority ranges from -2 to 3. Get a valid OS-dependent process priority code.

source.manager.getProcessPriorityCodes()[source]¶

Get a dictionary of OS-dependent process priority codes.

source.manager.manage(on_startup_schedule_file=None)[source]¶

Initialize a UI process and enter an event loop to handle communication with that UI. Manage the creation of dispatcher processes to execute schedule files and facilitate communication between the UI and the currently running dispatcher.

source.manager.onPosix()[source]¶

Detect whether running on Windows or Posix.

source.manager.startDispatcher(schedule_file_path, priority=0)[source]¶

Start a Process running dispatcher.dispatch(schedule_file_path) and obtain a two-way Pipe for communication.

source.manager.startUI(priority=0)[source]¶

Start a Process running ui.start() and obtain a two-way Pipe for communication.
